description:
Castro sushi at its best. Every time I order here, whether it's fresh fish or something from the kitchen, it is really delicious.  The bento boxes are plenty servings and cheap!!! 

Nice lighting and feel inside.  I really enjoy listening to their music selection and people watching on my lunch break.
author: Meagan M.

description:
Swung by Osaka Sushi for a casual dinner while we were in town visiting a friend. 

Nestled among other bars, restaurants, and shops, Osaka Sushi is unassuming and compact - but welcoming and friendly nonetheless.

I ordered a seaweed salad and the Shoyu Ramen, which piqued my interest when we saw it on the board outside as we entered.

The ramen was pretty good - I wish the egg was soft-boiled instead of hard-boiled, but overall the flavor was great and extremely filling. The seaweed salad was a large portion and was just what I wanted.

Service was friendly and pretty quick!
author: Herbie H.

description: Had a great lunch experience today, worthy of a 5-star review. Was sat immediately during the lunch hour, the staff was friendly and very attentive, the food arrived quickly, and the restaurant was clean and inviting. I had the lunch special, which was the Bento box, where I elected the chicken katsu and California Roll for my entrees.  A bowl of miso soup arrived first, which was well-flavored and hot, followed closely by the Bento box. The katsu was nicely fried with good flavor, the California Roll was very fresh-tasting and good, and the salad was super fresh. Pricing was right on point for downtown SF/Castro area. I'll be back!
author: James E.

description:
Came here for a quick dinner before hitting up QBar next door and shared 3 veggie rolls with my girlfriend (shiitake mushroom, avocado, Japanese squash) plus miso soup and a large Sapporo. 

Everything tasted good -- the rolls were basic veggie rolls but tasted fresh and were rolled well. We ordered edamame also, but it never ended up coming. 

We were trying to beat the cover charge at Q so my girl got up and asked a different server for our check. On my mistake, I didn't look at the bill in the interest of time and when I went to sign the receipt I realized it was the wrong check. She voided it and brought the right one out fairly quickly, but service could overall be more attentive to detail and guests in general. 

The price was right and I wouldn't be opposed to coming back but it didn't stand out in comparison to other sushi spots around the city.
author: Alex K.

description:
Looking for a quick place to eat before a show at the Castro. 

They had Happy Hour menu items. We tried a variety of sushi and fried items. My friend really enjoyed it but i thought the quality of the food was ok. The price was right. Maybe I need to try something on the regular menu.
author: Mitzi W.

description: Excellent, speedy service - the menu's quite affordable and there's a relatively good variety for the range. I had the Chicken Udon and my friend had a Tempura and Chicken Teriyaki bento box; both were up to our standards and gave us a hearty serving. We're not from this area, but it's nice to see so much variety in the Castro - overall, would recommend! Glad we stopped here.
author: Christopher N.

description: Very good service, food ingredients were good but how my own sushi was made was abysmal. It's odd as others were coming out fine that I saw but sad that my own rolls were sloppily made, sauce just laid on, inconsistent slice sizes and poorly packed sushi nigiri. Had to take photos as was surprised at them. Mind you it was 11pm, hour before closing. Maybe I just got a slipshod one, don't know. Not sure what went wrong but I was hungry and wasn't in mood late night for sending them back. But you be the judge, see the photos and see what I mean.
author: Dieter D.

description:
Service was prompt for lunch. Bento box with two choices $10.95, I had spicy tuna roll & the tempura. Served with salad & rice, it's a perfect lunch. 
Just not wowed.
author: Rene C.

description:
Osaka!

All I need to say is this. I was walking on by and saw your menu posted. I took a look and hey your lunch bento price is PRETTY GOOD ($11 for 2 items, $13 for 3 items). So I chose to get some lunch with you. 3 items. Because I am a fat, I mean a foodie.

Received a massive bag full of goodness. Bento was large. Sorry i doubted you but I anything I get in SF I expect high prices and small quantities. Co-workers marveled at how much food I had on my table. Someone exclaimed, that looks awesome! Food came out fast. People were nice and the food was pretty spot on. But the best stamp approval for me is, I think I went to you 3 times that work week. I tried to order something different, but the bento deal was too good I couldn't. I've still failed to try anything else.

Bento Items
Chicken Katsu (3/5) - pretty good, I am just picky about chicken katsu. 
Tonkatsu (4/5) - larger and juicer than I expected. 
Tempura (5/5) - excellent quality, fried well
Yakiniku (3/5) - yummy, but tasted like a poor man's bulgogi. personally just prefer other items.
Alaska Roll (5/5) - salmon & avocado. not mini-sized. nice balance to all these fried items.

Everything not on bento menu - will I ever order something else? I hope so.. but it may never happen.

Ok Osaka

Until next time or maybe today.
author: Paul L.

description:
UPDATE:
I really had to update this review. My husband and I have not had any sushi for over 9 months because of this place. 
We ordered our regular, including one of our favorite rolls, Pink Lady Roll. We took our first bite and it seemed a little weird. Second one and we were like WTF. The chef had put a raw(!!) asparagus in our favorite sushi roll. After discovering this, which means taking apart the sushi and examine, we were both nauseous and disgusted. Our waiter said: oh well sorry.
I should have just thrown up all over the table and told them to F off. But we didnt. Paid our bill and left, for good.
author: Styn V.

description: Tried it once, probably pass on it in the future. It's a pretty packed spot on a Sunday afternoon. We got one of the last tables so didn't have to wait. Only tried the tempura and one of the specialty rolls since we heard the ramen wasn't that good. It was mediocre. Nothing to write home about so I'll keep this review short & sweet.
author: Ruby C.

description: This is one of my favorite sushi place even food is not the best int the world. But the services are nice.  And im sure people who will come here will get a good experience here
author: Noparit T.

description: Good place for late night dinner/snacks. Nice restaurant staff and friendly sushi chef
author: Cass L.

description:
I stopped by late last night. I saw Chicken Teriyaki, for
Under $12 on the menu outside, so I walked in and told the owner (I assume), that I would like Chicken Teriyaki to go. He had the waitress behind me, ring me up. The price then became $17, because the menu I saw was lunch.  She kept repeating to me how much my change was, I presume to suggest I tip her. What I had when I got home was grilled Chicken, marinated in soy sauce, on a bed of bean sprouts, with about ¾ cup of chopped green salad, without dressing, and a mysterious bright red flavorless, (like the rest of the meal), crunchy vegetable (in photo), and white steamed rice. Maybe the Sushi here is good. I consider any Sushi without parasites, good. I won't know, I won't be back.
author: Monte H.

description: This restaurant is amazing TikI did a wonderful job making sure I was taken care of. The sushi was awesome especially the rainbow rolls and 49ers rolls. The atmosphere at this place is very relaxing.  Will come again
author: Demario P.

description: I love this place. I've been coming here for the past couple of years and the food is pretty spectacular. The lunch bentos are amazing, and priced fairly good compared to other places. I come like twice a month because their server is this amazing guy, and the food is really good. The place has had its ups and downs, and by down I mean when it's packed and busy. But generally I rate this place 5 stars for the food and their service.
author: Walter P.

description: Great lunch joint.   I treat myself every so often to their Lunch Box which is a great value.
author: Scott H.

description:
Osaka is my neighborhood go-to for a predictably decent Japanese meal of terriaki and sushi.

The lunch bento box is a robust meal with  a choice of either 2 or 3 entrées. I usually get the chicken terriaki, spicy tuna roll and vegetable tempura, that includes shrimp. The meal also includes miso soup, rice and 2 types of salad.
author: Bulldog W.

description: The food is good but not the service. I ordered Bento whose portion is good enough for one person and there are Sashimi, salads, Ribeye inside
author: Tingying C.

description: Very nice whole in the wall Japanese restaurant with everything from Sushi, to Ramen.  The host was a bit indifferent upon arrival, but our service was very friendly and professional.  Really enjoyed the Udon.
author: R D.

description:
Came in at 9:30 on a random Wednesday night, I love that its open late! Very friendly workers and comfy restraurant to have a bite at. 

Ordered the tempura udon and roll- the udon was so delicious, soup was hot and flavorful just the way I like it and the tempura was cooked perfectly. Forgot which roll we ordered but it was also very good, I was just too full to really enjoy it. 

Overall not the best Japanese restaurant ever but good for the area and OPEN LATE NIGHT!
author: Jenny E.

description:
If you are on a sushi hunt in the Castro, I wish you much luck because the pickin's ain't that ripe over there. Sure, there's that sleeping tube of a spot, Sushi Time; then there's Takara Sushi on 18th which definitely has its high points; there's also that closet on Sanchez, Eiji, which has the silkiest tofu; and oh yeah, there's Wasabi and that boat place, Warakubune,... Wait a sec, maybe there are a lot of sushi places in the Castro, and Osaka has an enviable location right on Castro across the street from the theater (photo: http://bit.ly/2aRCm2a).

However, I found it disappointing in terms of freshness and flavor. Primarily due to its prime spot, it's a most popular, noisy place. I suppose mediocrity is not a showstopper among the club-hoppers. I have to say the server with the sunny disposition helped me feel comfortable at the mini-table right next to the front door. The menu is certainly robust enough, and I started with the $6.95 Yakitori, two skewers of BBQ chicken lacquered in a sweet teriyaki sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/2bq9NL3). The poultry was on the skimpy side, and it just made me shrug in utter indifference. For my main dish, I went for the $18.95 Chirashi.

I generally order it when I feel indecisive about the sushi and want to see how fresh their fish really is. It arrived and looked like I was eating the leftover pieces from the cutting board (photo: http://bit.ly/2aKD8Th). Compared to new places like Tsubasa Sushi in Hayes Valley, Osaka doesn't do anything remotely creative with their chirashi. It was just the standard selection of bait that barely passed the fresh smell test. They were also rather stingy with the rice underneath, and it looked like they added tamago to fill in the dish. When I think about it, there ARE a lot of worthwhile sushi places in the Castro. This just ain't one of 'em.

FOOD - 2 stars...just plain disappointing
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...crowded and noisy, even for the Castro
SERVICE - 4 stars...the one area where they excel
TOTAL - 2 stars...not feeling it in Osaka
author: Ed U.

description:
The waitress took our order and was then MIA for the rest of the evening.  She also neglected to submit our complete order, so we only received half our meal.

Lastly, I had the Chirashi and it was really trashy! EXACTLY as Yelper Ed U. described..."leftover pieces from the cutting board" and "just the standard selection of bait that barely passed the fresh smell test" It was gross.

Sadly, Osaka Sushi is just one more crappy restaurant in the declining Castro.
author: paul s.

description: So, I've been here a few times and the food has always been hit or miss. Unfortunately,  it's one of the very few places open after 10pm in the Castro. But what happened tonight when I got here at 10:10pm, I wait for 10 minutes to be seated although there was no one else waiting. And it didn't stop there...roughly 10 minutes after being seated, the server returns...not to take my order,  but to tell us the chef has informed her that they are now only taking/making To-Go orders. This took place at 10:20pm...although their hours posted everywhere, including online, said that they close at 11pm. Mind you, the restaurant had roughly 12-14 guests in it, enjoying their meals.
author: U. Sacred M.

description: Part of our order just didn't make it to the table. This is usually a favorite place to go, but the new waiters, especially Folsom Sunday, were horrible. May be the last time I come back. Sad to see a favorite go so far downhill.
author: Bradley V.

description:
I've always wanted to go to this place because every time I passed by it, they were advertising ramen!

I ordered soy ramen and it was actually good for the price. The noodles were good and it filled me up. I just had to add Sriracha sauce in it to get it to my spicy level.

I'd definitely come back and try their miso ramen!
author: Rick O.

description: One of the best Japanese restaurant in Castro. They alaways got the good deal which I really enjoyed . By the way. The waiter are super friendly. I usually come here with friends after party.
author: Clancy Y.

description:
I may have a new favorite thing. In terms of Japanese food. Beyond nigiri. Osaka's sushi is average for San Francisco -- which means it's good. But they have a broad men I occasionally explore with fear and trepidation -- because I discovered Japanese food late in life (though I've eaten Korean since the third grade). 

A little background to explain why Osaka's soba noodles blew me away. 

I've been on a 90% vegetarian streak for weeks now. The 10% so far revolves around ham and good quality steaks. I had some carnitas recently that tasted like a dead animal. Same with chicken. Weird, huh? But ham and sirloin are okay. 

But tofu!!??!! Can't get enough plain chunks of it. Not formed in chikken patties or wok fried with sweet sauce. Just tofu. 

Well enough about tofu. 

So yesterday the three engines I attend, which normally provide a continental breakfast (you know, donuts and coffee), a nutritious and filling lunch (salad and rice, I have always disliked wings), and a snackable pre-dinner (trail mix and peanut butter crackers) failed to deliver. 

Although I was on time for all but the last (where there was one pack of crackers left), the other participants had consumed everything else. 

As in 8 people ate 24 donuts and a half gallon of half and half. As in twice the normal number of people were at the lunch. One person was dipping the last piece of bread into the grease left from the wings. Fingers had scooped any traces of hummous. There were smears of Caesar salad dressing to hint at what had once been there. 

I found half a banana and two nuggets of watermelon. I was sad. 

So after my last meeting, I was weak and cranky. And my 90% vegetarian leanings made Castro food choices a bit off. Budget inadequate to Catch or Fable. Not craving calorie laden Thai. Not being willing to walk to Church Street for Warakubune. 

And I thought of Osaka. Bento sounded good. 

But when I sat down, I saw a sign for "Ten zaru 11.95" which the sign described as cold soba noodles with tempura. 

"Hmmm," I thought. 

I saw a few things in the menu that were possibilities -- tempura mushrooms, octopus tsunomomo and the like. But I wanted to ask the server about the Ten zaru. "Dipping sauce? Daikon? Yes,  I understand the noodles will be cold. I'd also like some miso soup, please."

Well -- yum. Yum yum. Yum yum yum. Cold noodles in savory broth balanced by Osaka's always good tempura. One succulent shrimp, crisp green bean all interspersed with refreshing bites of buckwheat spaghetti and sesame seeds dipped into sauce. 

It was light. It was satisfying. I was very very happy. 11.95 plus soup.
author: Tim P.

description:
It's a-ok. 

I ordered some sushi and had a good experience, but it wasn't the best. 

Overall, just average.
author: Nina Y.

description: Best happy hour sushi and wine / drinks in town. If you're looking for cheap rolls and a California pour, this place is for you! We come here about once a week and we love it! The staff is amazing and super friendly and will take care of you if you make this spot your own or even if you don't!. Feels like family every time we walk in. The sushi is great the chicken karage is the best I've ever had. Not too fried but just the right amount of crisp. Whether you're an SF native or visiting from out of town, go to osaka. You won't be disappointed. Oh and I almost forgot...it's in the Castro and Q bar and hot cookie is right next door. How nice. I love Osaka and you will too! From the haight, with love.....
author: Alys B.

description:
The food is ok, but both recent visits had really slow and ultimately unfriendly service. It was so bad that it ruined our dinner even though we are pretty forgiving customers. 

It seems that they need more servers/bussers - or come up with other solutions for busy periods.
author: G M.

description: I needed to call the server over twice to take my order and then to add soup to what I had ordered.  Great location, lovely people, but not great service.  I ordered a lobster roll with cucumber wrapped around, and fish roe on top, sounded great but they add a big dollop of hot sauce.  Just didn't work for me.  Wouldn't go back.
author: Sharon L.

description: I had not been out for Sushi in a while and I was REALLY REALLY hungry and so was my friend.  I was actually Hangry.   I got a bento box - chicken Katsu and a combo roll plate as appetizer.  It was kinda busy but service was great. Ambiance was good too.  I loved all the extras Miso, salad, rice , plus Sushi and the main item.  It was a lot of food and it was all great.  We were both full.
author: Sfclint O.

description: I stop by the other day. very friendly server Nori greets me. have the lunch box special.  very Delicious.  fast friendly service.
author: Mike E.

description:
Nice place to come and have some small bites. Was there for lunch, ordered lunch box and one item was chicken teriyaki, Oh chicken could've been  more grilled and it should have more flavor....only what I taste was kinda uncooked meat with no taste or desire to be eaten.
Three stars only for location, clean place and good sushi.

You guys should taste it before it leaves kitchen!!

Chicken sent back.
author: Emir L.

description: Great sushi, fast pleasant service, and a really good happy hour! Stumbled upon this place and it was great, 10/10 will eat again.
author: Shane Y.

description: Great happy hour prices but servers could not have been ruder yelling at me to move seats twice, then yelling at me to order from the other server after 15 min or no order being taken, and sushi is way below average in quality loose rice, not well cut fish, ginger a bit old.
author: Matt H.

description:
Looking for lunch in the Castro?

You can pay ten bucks for a sandwich, a burger, a burrito, or.... you can go to Osaka and get their lunch bento box.

$10.95 and you get to choose 2 items from a list of 10 options. Also includes rice, edamame, salad, and miso soup. Add $2 more and you can have 3 items.
Tempura, teriyaki chicken, salmon, sushi rolls, etc are all on the list.


Def recommend to come here for not only for the great values, but the fresh quality of the food as well.
author: Kevin C.

description: Came here for dinner on a Saturday evening.  Not too crowded, speedy and friendly service.  Food was also good and appeared to have Japanese w/ Hawaiian influence. I ordered the Hawaiian style poke bowl, others in my group ordered bento box, tonkatsu, and vegetable sukiyaki so got to try a bit of everything.  I'd definitely come back here when in the mood for Japanese food.
author: Dan O.

description:
Quality of foods = dowm

plates , bowl uncleaned , smell like urine .
author: Paon C.

description:
By far the BEST Sushi in our immediate Castro Village.
These are lovely people. The sushi chefs, Jun-san, Jimi-san and Chris-san are all fabulous artists in their own right and , I agree strongly, that they are ALL at the top of their form! 
Treat yourself to an OMAKASE, chef's choice, for the best they have and enjoy. You can thank me later. LOL.
author: Xenry X.

description:
Must first say what was up with the brutally cold San Francisco weather? I guess San Fran should be called the windy city instead of Chicago:/ or maybe it was just my luck... anyhow I was in the mood for something steaming hot... what better option than Ramen! We saw a sign outside of  Osaka that said Ramen and we immediately ran in. 

Upon entering we were doused with the super strong fish smell. I almost immediately walked out it was so strong but my cousin, her husband, friend, and I decided to sit and check out the menu before we made another choice. We asked about the ramen since it was no where on the menu and there were literally three choices written on a piece of paper hanging behind us. 

We decided to go with the miso ramen. I asked for it not to have meat since I don't eat pork. It took longer to bring the ramen than it did to bring out the bento box order my cousin's husband order.... anyhow finally when it arrived it was perfectly HOT as I planned on and included the spice powder I love so much. The egg however seemed like a pickled hardboiled egg instead of the usual poached/ fried egg I'm used to. It was kind of yummy with the ramen just different. There was also some imitation crab slices I was not a fan of. Overall not terrible but not great the price was also okay at $11.
author: Astrid M.

description: I tried bento box! It's really delicious! Different items you can choose and the portion is quite enough. I'd definitely come back!
author: 奕涵

description:
This is a wonderful place for Japanese food and is consistently enjoyable. Their menu is large suiting anyone with dietary restrictions. The servers are very efficient and helpful. 

I come here often when I need a Japanese food fix when in the Castro.
author: Keith A.

description:
Came here for date night a couple days ago and we had a nice time. The service was great - always had full water and tea cups (green tea is free!) and our orders were taken promptly. 
The only non-positive comment I have is the food is fine but not great - but that's a lot of what makes or breaks a restaurant! I ordered the grilled mackerel and my boyfriend ordered the tempura udon. Nothing stood out to us in particular with either dish and my boyfriend actually didn't like the mackerel because it tasted "too fishy". I thought it was okay, but I was definitely mooching off of his udon more than I was eating mine. I took my fish to go and it was fine for leftovers the next day for lunch.
author: Mio W.

description:
Osaka Sushi is a great little spot located on Castro St.  The food is good and service is great. A few friends and I started with the Tempura assortment, which had some tempura green beans, broccoli, and onions. We also got a few rolls to share, which were very filling. We came in hungry, and between the four of us, we split five rolls, which was more than enough. 

The roll that stood out was certainly the Super Fire. Everyone at the table agreed it was the best one, and it was served on a flaming dish. Great sushi, good experience, and very convenient before/after hitting up some Castro bars.
author: Mike D.

description:
During some partying time in the Castro, my friend and I decided to get some food so we had a good foundation for the rest of the evening. We came across a couple of sushi joints on Yelp but ultimately chose this for the convenience with proximity to where we were at the time. 

When we got in, we were sat right away. Lot's of table top seating for  your convenience. The spacing between the tables were a bit small but I managed to fit into the booths. The light colored wood accents and walls, along with the Japanese style plants and decor made for a very authentic Japanese vibe. The service was awesome! She was super nice and accommodating. My friend asked about a potential iPhone charger and she was nice enough to get one for the table. Super appreciative of that. For dinner, here's what I got:

-Kamikaze roll for $5. Yellowtail, Hamachi, with green onions in a roll. It was alright. A nice piece of hamachi in the roll, the green onions weren't overpowering. Not jumping out of my see but for the price, I would get that again. 

-Miso ramen for $10.95. This miso ramen was filled with noodles, bamboo, seaweed, egg, pork, onions, and green onions. It was packed with toppings. Throughout the dish, I kept commenting on how many things were in here. Appreciated the amount of food. I thought there was a little too much onions in there and not enough noodles. The flavor was a little bland though, in my opinion. Other than the milky look to the broth, I couldn't really tell it's miso characteristic. Maybe more miso or more salt in the future. 

Overall, it was a good place. The food was filling and the service was great. I would definitely be back to check out other dishes and maybe another type of ramen next time. If you're in the area, come check them out.
author: Rockne H.

description: Although affordable (especially during happy hour), the food is mediocre and the service is TERRIBLE - I could see completed plates sitting on the sushi bar for 10 minutes before the waitress brought it to me (along with the one hot app. I ordered with was, of course, no longer hot). At one point she came to my table while talking on their cordless telephone and later said nothing to me as she left the check. Clearly she has come to expect the "automatic tip" - but for the first time in my life, I didn't leave even that. Nothing to recommend about this place - especially in a neighborhood with other options.
author: Anna C.

description:
Came here for lunch on my sick day (tsk tsk why was I even out?) and because I was craving some miso soup.

Lunch is probably a good time to come here because of their awesome lunch special. You are able to pick 3 items and they'll whip it up in a bento box. I chose the teriyaki chicken, 5 piece sashimi, and the beef. It also comes with a salad, miso soup, and edamame. Pretty decent for $12-$13 especially in San Francisco?

I was really surprised with the quality of the food since I saw a lot of bad reviews here. Their teriyaki chicken was juicy, their beef was soft and flavorful, and the sashimi tasted pretty decent. The most important thing to me is meat to rice ratio in my meals, and I felt like this meal was perfect. They give a generous amount of food, and that made me very happy :)

The waiter was really nice, and the service was fast because the restaurant wasn't too busy during lunch time.
author: Grace H.

description:
Awful loose rolls, fish didn't taste fresh, white hamachi nigiri with a sloppy slathering of wasabi. All around a huge disappointment. So excited to see Jimisan walking around but the sushi chef working was awful and I can't imagine him being able to save the place from poor seasoning and skimpy and fishy tasting rolls.

We told our server how bad it was and he laughed and said we finished it but it was all packed up and we let him know..."this is for a homeless person" and even then I felt a little bad. 

Even the tempura was flavorless and cooked in oil that wasn't hot enough. The sauce was bleh as well. Only good thing we had was the tea and a salad.

I wouldn't trust it. Some of the worst sushi I have had yet in the Bay Area. Save your belly and try any other place than this.
author: Zaviera R.

description:
We went here for lunch and they had great lunch boxes and appetizers. The Soft Shell Crab,Tempura,Miso soup and teriyaki very good. I will likely to return and bring couple of friends to try it.

prices reasonable , parking on the street but hard to find spots
author: Michelle M.

description: Not my favorite, though the food did come quickly. I ordered miso ramen and it looked wrong from the moment it arrived: the broth was too clear. Were they running low on miso? Who knows... didn't taste right, though, and it was definitely too thin. The egg was very hard boiled and clearly fresh from the fridge (cold). The pork was too firm. It's usually my favorite part and this time I left it floating in the bowl. Overall, very underwhelming. Maybe that's why they never checked on us after delivering our food? Next time I will pass - plenty of great options in the area.
author: Jeremy B.

description: The place is really good. I love their sushi and bento boxes. It's a nice friendly neighborhood place. Just some of the servers don't have the best customer service, they seem to rush around and not pay attention sometimes. My two favorite servers are tiki and Tuulka tho, they are amazing and funny. And the owner is a great person as well. No matter what server though it's still a good place to eat. They are great to the Castro community and I love going there
author: Antonio S.

description:
I avoided this place for years, my 'sushi snob self' saying 'there cannot be good sushi in the Castro.' Well, I was wrong. This is a more than decent neighborhood sushi place. If you just wanna go out for an easy bite with friends, then go! 

The presentations are not fancy, but they're straightforward and nice. The simple secret of good sushi is the quality and freshness of the fish; I have never had anything here that was remotely 'fishy,' be it rolls or sashimi. Always clean and fresh and clearly quality.

If you go on a Friday or Saturday night when all the gay boys are in their drunken party mania mode, service can be kind of random. I think most of the waiters are young with little experience, and do not handle the crowds well. During the day, however, they're considerably more attentive. But still, '3-star service.' Nothing to deter you. 

Happy Hour is a real stand out. I go often when I 'work from home' and want to bail early. From 4-6, Happy Hour menu includes discounted saki and beer, and small plates that are not always on the menu, usually in the $3-5 range. So great to share a few dishes with friends, or have on your own before you launch into your 'gay drunken party mania mode!'

If you want 4-star in the Castro, go to (considerably) more expensive Takara Sushi around the corner. Or Restaurant Eiji - http://bit.ly/1NI1ZlB - I reviewed that one forever ago, but it is still great.
author: Corey M.

description: I decided to give this restaurant a try today and what a nice surprise. I ordered the 3 items lunch box and I chose salmon teriyaki, chicken Kara age and spicy tuna roll and I enjoyed it through and through. The portion was also very copious, coming in from Toronto, Canada, I must say that we do not have anything similar taste wise and portion wise. The price was also very reasonable. I will recommend Osaka sushi and I will definitely return for another great meal! Kudos also to the very nice and hardworking servers at the restaurant! Give Osaka sushi a try and you will like it!
author: Matthew L.

description:
Not bad...just isn't good.  The sushi is seafood rice rolls drenched in sauce. 

What they do to raw fish is what Starbucks does to coffee.  I'll still go to Starbucks if I need a "coffee" flavored drink...and if there isn't a better option nearby.

That's how I feel about Osaka...only if I'm in the area and need a quick "sushi" flavored fix.  Doubt we'll be back...there are much better options in this city.
author: Zoran L.

description: Happy Hour prices are misleading.  1/2 priced Dragon Roll is 1/2 of a full size Dragon Roll, says this in writing on their menu.  1/2 price for 1/2 the food is no happy hour special price
author: Jason B.

description: They were ok. Kinda of expensive. I ordered their sashimi combo plate deal and unfortunately they put a TON of wasabi on the sushi that I had to scrape it off and couldn't eat the rice. the fish tasted pretty fresh. Nothing spectacular.
author: Heather S.

description:
Rolls here are decent, but service is terrible. Also, don't do the tropical rice dish with kiwi (don't waste $12 for them to mix rice with kiwis and avocados) even if you think it's interesting.

We came on a busy Friday night so did expect some lag. While the first few things we ordered came out fine, and I got a soda that I never ordered that was later taken away...they bombed on saying "Yes, we'll get you that last roll," and then never bringing it out. They also never brought out plates. I might as well have eaten off of the table.

We waited 30 minutes for this special fire roll and empty glasses of water the whole time that were never filled. When the 30 minutes was up, we got the check but no roll. 

Jokes on you, Osaka Sushi, I'm not coming back!
author: Michelle N.

description:
At the request of my dining companion I had lunch here.  Knowing this place belongs to Nam K. who also operates Slurp across the street, should have tipped me off.  (See my review for Slurp)

The food was a disaster.  I pushed it around my plate, careful not to eat it.  After traveling around a world, I have an amazing ability to know what not to eat.  My lunch date wasn't as lucky.

The worst part was the service.  Poor girl was in the weeds, from the minute we walked in to when we finally got our check and exited.  

My lunch date spent the remaining afternoon on the toilet.
author: EC N.

description:
Forever Young roll...

Sushi hopping tonight, this was our 1st place. Weds night @ 630pm, place was pretty empty, very prompt service, very nice service at that. Roll was good, too much rice, a bit sweet but the wasabi helped cut some of that sweetness.

About 20 tables, not too small but definitely not huge so there may be wait on a busier night.

I'd say this a "go-to" place if something better wasn't available.
author: Stacie R.

description: Food was really good. Didn't care for the teriyaki salmon in the bento box but chicken karate and California rolls were pretty darn tasty.
author: Val S.

description: Got the tempura udon (4.5 stars) and the fire cracker (I think) roll (4 stars). Rounding up for the sushi bar seats and the attention to service. Would definitely come back for a bite in the Castro.
author: Joshua F.

description:
Look, this place isn't going to fool your tastebuds into thinking you're in Japan....but your wallet will thank you for making the trip. 

Happy hour is M-F 4-6pm. 

$2.50 beer and hot sake. $2-5 appetizer / small entrees. 

How far can you go wrong for $2? Stop in, you won't regret it.
author: Kamila L.

description: We were seated right away on a Late Saturday evening. Our waitress was educated in The quality of the sushi and super welcoming . Very relaxed casual warm environment in the heart of the Castro. The Uni was so fresh and sweet and the fact the have "wild" salmon makes Osaka a 5 star restaurant in my book.
author: jennifer d.

description: I've lived in Castro and eaten at this place many many times before for years. Used to be a good restaurant before the new management took over/bought. Now the quality is bad, service sucks, and way overpriced for the food. I'd seriously rather buy sushi from Safeway than eat here. Not going back again.
author: P M.

description:
I freaked a little after seeing a food safety alert about this place. Meh, I ate there a couple of nights ago and I'm still alive, so whatevs... 

Not bad, not great. Average sushi and average service. Prices are reasonable considering where it is located.
author: David S.

description:
Being half Japanese I am always on the hunt for good quality well priced sushi/fish. I personally think this place has the BEST sushi happy hour menu in the city. I am ALWAYS looking out for good sushi places that offer happy hour. I also really like that this place has a legit Japanese (not positive he is, my mistake if I'm wrong of course) chef, which I feel like adds a bit more authenticity. This isn't a place where it's just a bunch of low level prep cooks microwaving and defrosting your pre-cooked food. Granted, I only really come here for the happy hour because all of my favorites are about half off. The happy hour is from 4pm-6pm Monday thru Friday. The menu includes:
- Edamame roughly $2.95
- Assorted Tempura $3.95 
- Fried Calamari $4.95 (My favorite)
- CA Roll $3.95

Sips:
Japanese Beer (small) $2.50
Glass of Nigori $3.50
Karatanba Glass $5
Small hot sake  $2.50

I think they have a few other items but those are the ones they list on the board outside daily. I haven't been there in a very long time, but last time I was there they had a pretty large Happy Hour menu. Anywho the quality is pretty good over all, nothing amazing but haven't had any issues with the food here. Yes, the service can be a bit slow but, again, I haven't been here in quite sometime so I'm not really fit to review the service at this time. I popped my head in there this afternoon right before happy hour was over, and the place was empty. I would definitely suggest going during happy hour during the middle of the week if you can. It seems to be little busy so they are able to make your food hot and fresh pretty quickly. I have been here when it's been a bit more crowded too and no major complaints. Don't expect anything super spectacular or amazing but definitely worth a shot! For more authentic, go to Eiji on Sanchez. This place is good though no real complaints! Going to give happy hour a shot soon and will update again.
author: Tara S.

description:
We ate at Osaka Monday evening, Dec. 28, 2015... and my wife was sick all night, food poisoning... we suspect the salmon, it was being camouflaged with slices of lemon.. She's recovering today, didn't check yelp before entering the restaurant, should have, cause this warning pop up... 

 "Following a recent inspection, this facility received a food safety rating that is in the bottom 5% locally, and is categorized by inspectors as "poor.  Being in the consumer protection business, we care a lot about your safety and will display this alert for six months or until we receive a significantly improved food safety rating for this business."
author: Hulleah T.

description: This is the worst customer service I have experienced within the restaurant industry. Our sever could not split the checks properly and got frustrated and gave us extensive attitude when we asked how much we would each be charged. She threw her hands up and said "oh my god" and clearly did not know how to split the check correctly. We each got overcharged and not treated properly. The one star is because the sushi was good, will never be returning.
author: Candy A.

description: Visited this place twice, but won't be going back. Servers are inattentive to customers. They got my order wrong and it took me 5 to 10 minutes to get their attention in an empty restaurant. I ordered their ramen the last time and the broth was off. I couldn't tell what it was. Saving the best part for last, I finished the noodles and bit into the one piece of pork. Omg, the pork was so stale, I spit it back out. Then I realized the weird taste in the soup was staleness. Disgusting and a health hazard.
author: Rachel C.

description:
This review is specifically for my experience earlier this week. I went in during lunch hour and was happy with the varietes of lunch items they offer. They have at least 20 things that are included in their bento box menu. $11 for 2 items, $13 for 3. They had california rolls, sashimi, teriyaki chicken, beef, tempura etc. I choose to get the 3 item, Tempura(veggies with 1 shrimp), Beef and Grilled squid.

First came a complimentary miso soup, which was good, nothing special.

The bento box came and it included the beef, tempura, a cup of rice and a cupsize salad with miso dressing. Although they missed my grilled squid. I waited a bit to see if it's coming but 10 mins later, i decided to ask for its whereabouts. They did mention that they forgot to add it. I was already irritated a bit because it's been a while and I only have an hour for lunch. They came after another 10 mins and gave me a plate of calamari. I said that that's not my ordered. The young girl had mentioned that I said squid. I know what I ordered and it sure was not calamari. I would have let it go but she insisted that she was right, and that's how their squid comes. I mentioned to her no, you have grilled squid in the menu. She seemed baffled and bit taken back, seemingly trying to prove that she was right, she showed me the menu. I then pointed to her the "grilled squid" option. She was embarrassed!

It's been an hour and I couldn't wait. I asked for the bill and that took  while as well. Normally, i wouldn't mind waiting for the check, but the place was empty - no reason for the lag.

All in all, this place is pretty good but nothing exciting.
author: Jan R.

description: Perfectly average nigiri and rolls in every possible way. Service is decent, and food comes out fast enough to make this a quick in-and-out place if you want to fulfill those sudden sushi cravings. Indeed, that's how many other patrons seem to view it - a place with high-turnover tables that's just perfect for a quick fix. The very definition of a Yelp 3-star establishment.
author: Vincent L.

description:
First of all, how did my chopstick thing only have one chopstick in it? It was the white paper sleeve kind, and it was totally sealed and untampered with. It just happened to contain not a pair but a single chopstick. I don't recall seeing such an occurrence before at any restaurant. Jeez, talk about cutting corners. Kidding.

I'd been here once before when I literally ran in between screenings of some film festival to order takeout edamame, eat it in the rain outside Q Bar where my L friends (not LGBTQAS, just L this time) were hanging out, then walk back to the theater and shove the rest into my mouth and talk chubby bunny-like with the ticket takers as the festival unpaused.

So, after a chance MUNI ride that landed me in the Castro, I decided to try this restaurant for real. The servers were nice, and the guy server looked like Final Fantasy. A table was immediately available on this particular Tuesday evening just after 10 pm. Aside from the servers, I was the only Asian. Aside from the servers + the cooks, I was the only non-white person. This doesn't matter to me - I only mention it because I know some people look at these restaurants through a "how many Asians are there?" scope. For the record: one.

The pair of white girls sitting two tables down from me were of the university varsity pullover hoodie variety. I wasn't paying attention to their conversation or their food, but I did take notice when one of them sent a crab (sashimi? roll?) dish back because "It isn't fresh - it's very bad." She opted to just go without food instead of getting a replacement, but she eventually got a plate of something other than crab.

I ordered the $18.95 "dinner box", which lets you choose 2 from among 21 items and comes with rice, salad, and miso soup. I chose chicken katsu and calamari katsu, and they were each served with a different condiment. I'd say the dish was... alright. The chicken was on par with McNuggets. The calamari had an unexpected look and feel. There's a texture you'd expect, then there's a "is this really from the sea?" texture, which was what I got. Sizewise, it didn't feel like an $18.95 load of food.

I also ordered uni (sea urchin), and a funny thing happened with it. They only had one left, which I received. My server said I'd be charged half since the price was for 2 pieces. A minute or two later, they said I simply wouldn't be charged at all. I didn't know if the prior crab incident had set up a chain reaction of apologetic behavior or if this was just how they did things. In the old days, failure would've meant slicing oneself open then being beheaded. Perhaps this modern rendition was decapitating the price.

Somehow, I can still picture myself here in the future. On most days, it's open an extra hour beyond other places in the area. The service was on-point, but the dishes were each lacking in one way or another. Overall, I'd say 2 1/2 stars.
author: Dan B.

description: This is the only place I ate that day and I got Food Sickness. I got the Lunch Box with Tuna Rolls, California Rolls, and Salmon Rolls. I have never been so sick in my life. I was there for lunch and by the time dinner came around i didn't feel well so I went to sleep in my hotel room and when my friend woke me up i was sweating something fierce. I then began throwing up over and over until I was throwing up yellow stomach bile.  Later it started coming from my bowels. I had to fly back to Texas the next day wearing a Depends Diaper!!! So go eat there if you want to.
author: Ashley T.

description:
I gotta start off by saying that the service was great. The wait staff were attentive without being intrusive, very polite and just all-around nice. 

Dropped by after an aggressive hike up Twin Peaks so I was in need of fuel.

While their lunch boxes are good value, so are the lunch boxes at most sushi restaurants so there wasn't anything too noteworthy here. I had salmon teriyaki and tempura. 

The salmon had a good crisp to the skin and was grilled well. Tempura was decent, though they loaded it up with the veg. I mean, what was with the huge slice of potato tempura? I don't even know where they found a potato that huge to get a slice that diameter. Yes, I'm obsessing with the potato because it was so hilariously huge.

But regardless, this is a solid place for lunch.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Food is good but service is luke-cold.
My son explained to me that is is cultural and that Japanese restaurants don't have to provide friendly service -- but when the bill comes and the waitress (Jinah) throws the check across the table without any eye contact or a "thank you"....

Highly recommend for food and ambiance but the staff could use some basic training -- smiling, making customers feel appreciated and basic gratitude -- which should be universal. 

My server, Jinah, looked fairly miserable the entire time I was there and it wasn't all that crowded. And for $60, I didn't get a "thank you." That bummed me out not to hear those two words. I don't eat out that much, and when I do, I want friendly service.
author: Susan B.

description: First off let me start by saying I am a Sushi addict! If I was stranded on a desert island and could only bring one thing it might very well be a sushi roll. I have been to Osaka a few different times and it always delivers. The rolls are great and reasonably priced. The service is usually quick and table wait times are always low. The atmosphere is very casual so keep that in mind but otherwise, Osaka is one of my standards for overcoming sushi cravings in the Castro.
author: David H.

description: Great for late night eats! Staff is friendly, food is good, and the atmosphere is comfortable. Been here three times and it hasn't disappointed.
author: Anari M.

description:
Definitely not going back. Came here on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch and I left pretty displeased. The service was absolutely terrible...When ordering, I specifically asked which rolls were cooked, because I'm just not a fan of raw fish. Our server then pointed a few to me on the menu. My friend and I ended up ordering 3 rolls, a tempura appetizer, seaweed salad and miso soup. When we received the rolls, the one I had ordered (the one that the server specifically pointed out as cooked) turned out to be a raw fish roll. I called the server over and asked if this was the roll she had said was cooked. She was confused as to what I was asking her... When I told her I specifically asked for a cooked roll she just smiled and looked puzzled. She stood there for a good while not knowing what to say. I was so annoyed at this point, I just let it go. My friend was upset and said we should complain further, but I wasn't in the mood. 

As far as the other food, everything was okay. Nothing spectacular that would make me come back to Osaka. 

If this place had good customer service she would've apologized and brought me a COOKED roll. If I had been allergic to raw fish this would've ended badly. To add to it all, our total was $80 for two people. This place isn't even all that. Save your money and get your sushi elsewhere.
author: Stefany Z.

description: Meh I really wanna like this place and I used to get sushi all the time here bar was amazing but this visit wasn't so good. I got the salmon avocado roll and tempura on the lunch special. The miso soup was good, but really how do they mess that up.  The tempura was good.  Nothing special but the roll was so gross. I couldn't finish it. The fish didn't taste fresh and the salad was kinda eh.  I really was surprised because it's the opposite of so many positive experiences in the past.  But the wait staff was amazing.
author: Joshua M.

description:
I dont know what they put in their rolls but man it made me and my friend sick. It tasted fine but within 15 minutes my stomach ballooned up and lets just say it was not a fun night.

Do not eat there!!
author: T J.

description:
I've walked by this place literally thousands of times. Years ago, someone told me it's not very good. I can't even remember who or when. But someone not too important, apparently, and it's been like 6 years.

So my friends wanted to go, and I said sure, why not. Get inside and realize that it's actually cute. The waiter was equally cute. The service was pretty standard, but zero complaints. The sushi was delicious and looked gorgeous. Prices were the tiniest bit on the high side, but not really substantially so.

I stand corrected, all these years I've missed out. Unless there's been a new sushi chef since '07, which is highly likely. I'm a fan, now. And want to check out this happy hour I hear so much about.
author: Sean B.

description: This is one my favorite Sushi places in SF, and its only a short walk from where I live. I have always had great service here from my waiter. Typically go for the sake, edamame, and a plate of Chef's Special. Depending on how I'm feeling, I go for the nigiri or sashimi plates. The fish has always tasted very fresh, and they have some really good special rolls.
author: Bryan M.

description: Among the worst food I've had ever. Lazy staff, can't say the sushi tasted fresh. Just do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. A total waste of time and money.
author: William S.

description: Happy hour here is good. Service sucks. I came at 5:5p hoping to get some ramen which is very good btw. The server said HH was over. I said it's before 6. He said no. What gives? The guy could have had business but instead decided to be uncool. I went next door to Cafe Mystique. Soup was tortilla & it was great.
author: Scott F.

description:
It's not the best sushi in the Castro, but with it's prime location, Osaka Sushi is a convenient place to grab some light nosh before the bars. 

It's a fairly typical sushi place with all the usual suspects. I don't think anything really jumped out at me on the menu although they do have a couple of interesting specials on the board. They do have a decent selection of veggie rolls though so that's easy if you have vegetarians in your group. 

The happy hour between 4-6pm offers a nice time to grab some food before (or after) drinks. They have a couple of rolls for around $3.50 - spicy tuna/salmon (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TSr8ZA7gY2TC1qhghxJFUg?select=mvfzCBKnAKwA805ia3EcCA) and California. Other bites include chicken karage (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TSr8ZA7gY2TC1qhghxJFUg?select=crEvB1zm1qAPE52qGYjV2g), assorted tempura, and edamame. Last but not least, beers are just $2.50. Fantastic pre-game! 

For sushi in the Castro. I'm still a fan of Eiji but for a pit-stop between bars, Osaka is just fine.
author: Jon L.

description: Average sushi place on Castro in San Fran. Service was average, food was average and nothing really stood out. I would go back if I was passing by and hungry for sushi but would not seek it out!
author: Shawn M.

description: My favourite Japanese Restaurant in the Castro. The Sushi here is amazing and the Service is Spectacular! Came in with a friend for dinner before going to Theatre and ordered Lots of Sushi & it was entirely Delicious! The presentation was also beautiful. I loved everything about this Restaurant! I was also looking at other people's food and everything looked enticing! From Sushi to Sashimi to items off the Grill, even Bento all looked great! I had a lovely time here!
author: Julian I.

description: Totally awesome. Had the dragon roll (yum!) and the tempura ice cream which I haven't had since my 13th birthday. My waiter and waitress were super polite and fast too :) If you are in the area, give it a shot.
author: Lunetta K.

description: Once again never a bad experience at Osaka, best sushi. I love this place from the staff to the food get what you pay does not exist here. Priced well with attentive staff and delicious food I do recommend Osaka to all my friends and family. You should definitely try it.
author: Ryan R.

description:
We came here with a friend who had nothing but nice things to say about the food so we were totally game to get lunch here.

They have a happy hour from 4-6pm which includes both food and drink items. Very decent prices as well. Our party of three ate like kings for $50 total!

The food was very tasty as well. I ordered a California roll, Alaska roll, Gyoza, and we shared a bowl of edamame. All of my sushi tasted fresh and delicious and the Gyoza came out hot and fresh. My boyfriend had the chicken karaage and thought it tasted good as well. Our friend had some spicy tuna rolls and an Alaska roll that he really liked. Cold asahi beers, fair customer service, decent price. What more could we ask for? Definitely coming back in the future!
author: Liz G.

description: Food is comparable to most sushi restaurants. The prices are outrageously high. You can feed a family of 3 instead of a purchase of a bento box.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This review is too bad.  
Just moved to the Catro hood and picked up sushi for myself and my roommate.  I got a sashimi platter that was REALLY good, like exceptional.  My roommate ordered a salmon skin roll, which she said was "meh" and then on top of that, she ended up all night throwing-up, the result of food poisoning.  
She was sick the entire next day and the sushi roll was the only she she had eaten the night before.  I wasn't sick at all, but also didn't eat her dish.
I called Osaka to let them know and they offered to have a manager call me.  "okay, sure.".  Well, then no one ever followed-up.  My goal was just to let them know and didn't serve it any more, they're the ones who offered to have a manager follow-up, and then it just never happened.
won't be going there again.
author: Courtney K.

description:
I brought it to the attention of the server that the prices on the menu were significantly higher than at the door.  He told me I'd just have to pay the higher price.  He went on to tell me there were cheaper things on the menu.  Rude.  His dismissive and aloof demeanor was off-putting and completely counter to what I expect when dining in a Japanese restaurant.  I asked for more tea and it was never brought to my table.  Instead the check was presented. 

I am a local resident and this place is on my way home. Further, I have a familiarity with Japanese culture from my travels and personal acquaintances.  The service here was completely unacceptable.  

Worst service I have ever received in a sushi bar or Japanese restaurant.  I will NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN.
author: Anthony H.

description:
I tried the omakase prix fixe on a weekend. I found all of the fish to be excellent; flavorful and distinct. The presentation was simple and elegant with some subtle additions that enhanced individual fish.
Caveats. Service was fine at the sushi bar but I wasn't in a hurry. I don't seek out sushi for fast food. I've eaten with the sushi man Jimi-san before here & another restaurant so he has some familiarity with my preferences, I felt I was really getting chef's specials and not end-of-service-life selections. Jimi-san is one of the few who will share his knowledge with you, so it's highly worth a visit.
author: Ken U.

description:
my half-Japanese friend recommended Osaka... so for some reason I thought it would be great...

but I still didn't like it.

I ordered the pink lady roll, and my friend ordered the crunchy salmon roll (maybe it was spicy salmon or crunchy spicy salmon... whatever) and neither of us really loved our rolls.  the pink lady roll was pretty small, and my friend's roll only had 5 pieces.

next time i'm in the area, I might consider heading to the sushi place down the street.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I ate Herr before and the food was OK. The Service is a disaster. We stopped by today and it felt we are bothering since everybody of the service group saw us but didn't talked with us. All guest recognized us standing around like idiots. In the end we got a table under the speakers (lound music was playing). The Menus are sticky and we felt not welcome at all. We left without eating :(
author: Anne L.

description:
1/1/13 Dinner

3.5*  This is the Castro go-to Japanese place if I need a quick fix. Many people have said the service is hit-or-miss but I always like it here. The price is just very Castro so expect to pay more especially the nigiri.

Menu is huge with lots of rolls and nigiris. I tend to get the same thing because I like sashimi and sushi. On this particular visit, I picked Sashmi Dinner (served with a bowl of hot rice) over the Chirashi (chef choices of sashimi over cold shishi rice) because it was cold out. Fish is fresh but the cut is a bit strange: in rectangular tubular shape instead of slices. Bf's dinner bento box is standard fare. Chicken katsu is tasty, crispy and not greasy. Gyozas were also tasty. Instead the usual seaweed he got picked cucumbers that night.

Overall the food is decent, not the greatest, but serves the purpose. The restaurant is clean and service is friendly.
author: Matt Y.

description: I order pretty standard rolls here since I'm trying to avoid fried crazy American rolls. Happy hour is very affordable and worthwhile. Last time I did takeout I watched this one guy watch his roll that was on fire. I admit, I was pretty entranced and I may have to invest in one of those. I would avoid the fish on a sizzling platter; completely bland and uneventful. Chicken udon was good for a cold day, but so many distracting vegetables to dodge.
author: Natasha P.

description:
My first visit to The Castro since the naked exhibitionists have been given free reign to parade around... which they do. Doing the best to avert my eyes, sometimes it is just not possible, like when one of the exhibitionists stands next to you on the sidewalk while waiting to cross the street. If they were ratable it would be less than 1 star. Oooops I digress on social commentary.... on with the review:

2nd visit to Osaka Sushi. Had a Bento lunch which had a good variety of well prepared items. Good & fresh quality and all properly prepared.

Food:

Calimari Katsu:  tender and tasty
Salad: Fresh with standard dressing
Edemame: good - properly cooked 
Rice: properly cooked (read: not mushy)
Miso soup - standard fare

Menu has lots of the "creative" rolls...didn't try.

Price :    I think it was $13 for the bento and you can add "chefs choice" of 5 slices of Sashimi for $1. Itsa giveaway. 

Service:     Great, attentive and quick

The owner recently opened a Korean restaurant @ Castro & 18th Streets...I may check that out sometime.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Although I live close, I hadn't been to Osaka sushi before but when the Giants won the World Series in 2010 (yes, this review is WAY late), we had to head down the street to Castro to celebrate with everyone else.  Since most people had made an evening out of watching the game, after choruses of "We Are The Champions" were all done, people were filing out of the area and we got a spot at Osaka for dinner.

Friendly service, fresh fish, and reasonable prices, especially being right in the heart of the Castro, on Castro proper.  Everything we had was tasty; a solid spot for sure.
author: Duckee D.

description:
Do NOT believe the yelp sticker in the door, yelp people do not love this place. That is pretty clear from the more recent reviews. Maybe Osaka used to be good, maybe their owners and chef used to care, and maybe customers left happy and full. But that is all in the past. What is it like now?

Very mediocre food and terrible service. The dishes are usually plain and unremarkable. Mostly warm sushi and warn hot dishes, warm everything. Likely due to fact that the kitchen / chef takes forever to do anything. Simple sushi order took over 30 minutes and was still wrong (it was just three rolls too).

After eating there I didn't feel well and while it was not food poisoning I am pretty sure they use very low quality fish (explains the budget prices) and do not always ensure they are fresh enough to eat.

I would not return.
author: Oliver L.

description:
UPDATE: They have a score of 71 which is considered high risk. One score less and it would be very high risk. 

This is the first sushi place I've visited in San Francisco, so I'm hoping this isn't how all sushi restaurants are in this city. The basic rolls were 6.00 for six pieces. That's basically $1 per piece. It tasted very meh and it took them over 20 minutes to make. I also waited for a water refill over 15 minutes and they weren't even that busy. I kept trying to catch a waiter or waitress but they at other tables and hard to stop. 

The miso soup was great however!

I wouldn't recommend this place, I'm hoping for a better sushi restaurant to experience in this city.
author: Levi R.

description: Delicious food and good service. Recommend sushi nigiri specials. freshest fish unfrozen from Japan. Good happy hour snacks too.
author: Tikki T.

description:
Great Sushi place in the Castro.

They do wonderful Bento Boxes and the Sushi is top notch.

Very reasonable prices.  Service is prompt and efficient.
author: Daniel P.

description: Came in on a cold day enticed by a sign saying that this restaurant serves ramen. I asked the waitress for vegetarian option and she said that I could get the udon dish with "a ton of vegetables" and substitute noodles. The dish came out with a few random pieces of broccoli and assorted vegetables floating in it and broth that lacked any real flavor. The wait staff was helpful and attentive but the food was incredibly disappointing. There is also poor ventilation and an overwhelming smell in the restaurant. Would not recommend,
author: Mary S.

description:
Went in last night to eat by myself. Wait staff was attentive and food came pretty quick (mind you that it wasn't too busy). I ordered the spicy chirashi and a couple of maki rolls (spicy salmon and kamikaze). The spicy chirashi was a mistake on my part as the sauce was way too spicy that it overpowered any flavors. The maki rolls were also ok. 

In conclusion, the fish was ok. For $45, I was a bit disappointed. The taste of the fish was just ok. Having just eaten at Warakabuni a few weeks ago, I much prefer paying the money there. The fish there had much more flavor and I would have gotten a lot more good food/fish for the same amount of money.
author: Sisounthone S.

description: Never order takeout. Waited for 25 minutes and left with no food.  Incompetence on the restaurant and Eat24's has become intolerable. From now on, I'm only ordering from UberEATS and Caviar.
author: Ryan K.

description:
Service was pretty good. Atmosphere fine. The ramen is what sucked though.

I ordered there Miso Ramen. Tasted nothing like ramen at all. The noodles were also stuck together in a clump, I honestly didn't think you could mess up the cooking noodles bit on ramen, so there you go.

Maybe the other things on the menu are great - I don't know. If I go back it won't be for ramen.
author: Christian T.

description: I'm from out of town, so I wasn't sure of this place. This place had 3 stars. I thought they made ldelicious sushi. I would come again.
author: Jay A.

description: It was not good. The California Roll rice was spoiled(yellowish instead of white) and slimy. I would be careful on their food quality.
author: Laurilyn V.

description:
Started "feeling delicate" shortly after lunch here today, and sure enough, I see their health score is 59.  I have enjoyed their food in the past, and even today was OK-tasting food and good service, so I won't give them just one star, but eating here is definitely not worth feeling crappy afterwards.

SF Health Department says anything under 70 is "poor" (their lowest category) and Osaka has been under 70 since March 2011.  And every inspection has gotten a lower score than the previous inspection:  69 in Mar'11, 62 in Dec'11, 61 in Sep'12, now 59 in Jul'13.  (See the Yelp scores summary or google sfdph restaurant scores.)

I'm giving Osaka a miss until they get at least an "adequate" score (86 or higher).
author: Chase P.

description:
Special Sushi roll prices were on par with others in the area, but i unfortunately didnt like either of the 2 i ordered. They seemed overly elaborate with various sauces that were too sweet and instead of enhancing the flavor, detracted from it.  The "delicious roll"  tempura part was overcooked and fishy. The "sweet heart roll" had too overly sweet sauces on it that didnt blend well imo.  So if you go, maybe skip those two rolls. 
Staff was good and attentive.
author: Matt W.

description:
The sushi was great, but the service wasn't. We sat ourselves down after receiving no recognition, and the waiter just kind of threw the menus onto our table and moved onto another table. I understand if you're busy, but you can just say "here are the menus and I'll be right with you." We were never asked how our food was and no refills on drinks. The place wasn't extremely busy.

I had one of the special california rolls with fried crab. Absolutely great to eat! I'm not a big sushi person, but this was still good to eat.

I wouldn't recommend this place solely based on service. We just simply didn't feel welcome.
author: Dylan R.

description: I had dinner at 11PM, just before they closed.  The service was quick and polite.  I didn't feel rushed.  The bento box was very good and typical for any sushi place.  This place is A-OK and pretty standard.
author: Joel L.

description: I order from  here using DoorDash and have to make special requests due to celiac. They always accommodate and I've never had any issue. Also, I've always been satisfied with the quality of the food.
author: Marc C.

description:
Stopped for a late night dinner. 

Overall, a great stop for some filling Japanese fare. Got the bento box w/ the teriyaki chicken and vegetable tempura option. Also, the dynamite roll.

For overall filling effect, the bento boxes take the prize. Well-stocked and fairly flavored.

The dynamite roll takes the award for best flavor variety, though. It really lived up to its name when you pop one into your mouth.

Only downside of the place: if you're coming in w/ a party of three or more, be prepared to wait. Looks like this place has a severe preference for two-seater furniture.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Dinner Sunday night didn't change my review one bit. But thought it might be useful to update you all and say things have not changed. 

There were 2 servers for a totally packed restaurant. Waiters were running around like crazy throwing things all over the place. It was a struggle to get napkins, chopsticks, water, soy sauce, soy sauce dish, etc..

I had the crazy roll this time which was delicious. So, food is still good, service is still bad, and this place still gets 3 stars.
author: Rachel E.

description: Great deal for happy hour! Good sushi and $2.50 Asahi beer. It's also on the main strip in the Castro.
author: Becky M.

description: I haven't tried everything on the menu, but they do have the best bento lunch set. Wide choice and huge portions.
author: Andrew S.

description: Bento box for lunch pretty decent! 14$ and a lot of food for the three item entry. Typical price for bento box in sf. I enjoyed myself with my good friend. We also could split checks which worked nicely. Service fast because it was a slow day. I'm very full and happy. This is my third time here, will come back!
author: Dis K.

description:
The fish has been sour over my past two visits. Never again.

61 health score. 

Bleah.
author: Jason S.

description:
I will stand proud and tall by my last review. In fact, if anything, Osaka Sushi may have even gotten BETTER!!!! Paul is gone but CHARLES is there. Very efficient, friendly and knowledgeable. Plus, Junesang and Rob are grrreat sushi chefs! I can't say enough about this place. Local Castro location and predictably good. A wonder-
ful addition to the staff is Take. Takesang is talented, patient, funny and smart. GO.
author: Xenry W.

description: Came here recently with my girlfriend and had some great sushi. Rolls were delicious, the sushi chefs were awesome, and the server was friendly and very attentive. The ambiance was nice as well. Will definitely be back.
author: Rob J.

description:
Decent sushi - the chefs seem to know what they're doing and it's always a packed house.  Even though I don't believe it's the best I've ever had, the prices are decent and the food is well above edible.

Try a new bottle of sake and enjoy the friendly atmosphere of the Castro while dining on some of your favorite rolls.
author: Kevin J.

description: One of worst experiences I have had, from the salad dressing (straight mayo) to the overcooked tuna tataki (if you can even call it that), and then to top it off, our sushi roll came out with ketchup drizzled on it. When we asked why there was ketchup on our sushi roll, they got angry at us and said it was their ketchup based "house" sauce, but it was really just straight ketchup. Sooo, if you like ketchup, mayo and mustard on your sushi, this is the place for you, but personally I like it only on my hot dog. Soooo horrible, I don't even yelp but after this experience I thought it was my duty to warn the general public.
author: Sheena C.

description:
Went in for lunch on a whim. Ordered Salmon Kama, and halibut entree.. Halibut was burnt, very gamey. Salad was meh. Had a big sign on the sidewalk that advertised Ramen, but when I sat down, they said they were out of Ramen (at 11:30 AM). Disappointing.

Green tea was good, as was miso soup. But, not coming back, nothing to really recommend it. The health reviews give me pause.
author: Jesse A.

description:
I had a pretty bad experience here last night. The waiter DANIEL was rude and our food took forever to come out. Pretty sure that some people that came in after us got their food before us. Also, I went to the back to use the restroom in the back kitchen area, which was occupied  at that moment, and was rudely told to "wait outside by the tables" by Mr Daniel himself. I'm pretty sure he didn't like that I was watching him put the edamame in the microwave, or was I invading his personal space? Also, why would the bathroom be in the kitchen area? So weird.

The food was alright, but I will never return. SF has way too many sushi options, and Osaka will never be a choice for me again.
author: Susana M.

description:
Last week I ate there salmon & avocado sushi I don't know what they call it but it was the best sushi I ever had as well as I had the sea food soup was very delicious as well
the manager Jana was very lovely and helpful too
Definitely I'll go again and try more of their food 
The prices was affordable 
I highly recommend to try this place I love it ,,,,
author: Mohammad Z.

description:
Taste:  5
Price:  4
Environment:  5
Service:  5
Friendliness:  5

One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  I've been coming here for years, and still try to come as often as possible.  The staff are all very friendly, and price is pretty good for what you get, the food is fresh, and the feel of the place is great.
One thing is that it can get pretty busy during dinner, so be prepared.  ;)
author: Ellary R.

description:
I hate to be this person but... "It's not what it used to be."

My wife and I have been going here for about 8 or 9 years, though less regularly since we moved out of the neighborhood. In recent times, they've renovated the place and changed the menus. I'm not sure if anything has changed other than superficially -- i.e. I am not sure if the owner changed -- but the food quality has seemed to go downhill. Overall the rolls are still good, but when tasting the fish as Nigiri, it is just not very high quality. The aji has always been mediocre but now all of the fish doesn't seem as good. My wife's crab salad tonight was inedible.

The service was great, so I added a star more than I thought I should (I was anticipating putting two stars).
author: Chris T.

description:
Don't eat here. The service was awful and the food was bad. I got stomach upset right after that. 
Also, when I asked for the bill. The waitress gave me the bill with her owe writing on it. She added the items to the bill.
Anyway, I will not come here again.
author: Don M.

description: A go-to place. Dependably good sushi, very friendly staff and a relaxed atmosphere.
author: Caleb H.

description: Can I do a no star or half a star? Been coming here for a long time and have been patient with their service. But tonight, being a chef, I got served at the pace of a snail. It wasn't super busy and took 10 minutes for our drinks? Not acceptable. Got worse as time progressed. Come here if you want SS - slow sushi. And no apology.
author: Jax C.

description:
WHAHhh, TWO STARS???

THAT'S IT???

I KNOW. I am usually very generous with my yelp ratings but Osaka was a let down tonight.

After coming out relaxed and happy from Always Tan Skin and Body after my deep tissue massage (ahhhhhHhhh.. relaxed sigh), I was ready to eat something delicious.

My friends and I stumbled upon Osaka Sushi at approximately 6:30pm.  This is right after happy hour ended. Even though the waiter seated us and handed us menus with the happy hour menu inside, when we asked him, he said we were too late and then quickly took back the menus.

Fine... ok. It's 6:32pm. I guess happy hour is technically over.

Whatever.

We ordered some sushi rolls and tempura. I was pretty hungry.  After waiting about 30 minutes for our food, I was getting pretty hungry.  After 40 minutes, our rolls finally came.  Did it really have to take 40 minutes to make three rolls??

I'm not sure.

Even though the waiters didn't check in with us or anything, it's okay because our food came except for the tempura.  I assumed that they forgot.  After we ate our three rolls (which were pretty small :(  ), we decided we needed more food and ordered two more.  These came pretty quickly this time, which made me wonder why it took 40 minutes the first time.

It's okay.

At around 8pm, we decided that we should probably head out soon considering it's been 1.5 hours since we sat down.  The tempura still has not arrived.  When I check in with the waitress, she didn't even wait for me to finish my sentence and left to check.  She came back minutes later with the tempura which was really hot, meaning they obviously just made it.  I think she might've mumbled a I'm sorry but I couldn't really hear her.   

Boo.

Dinner was still great.  Went with great friends, enjoyed good food and great conversation.  Osaka Sushi though, it was definitely "Meh" !  I don't know if I would go back. The only good thing about this place is probably the $1 small sake all night special on Tuesdays and Wednesdays...
author: Gloria C.

description: Great Bento Boxes and sashimi and rolls.  Convenient Castro location.  Love the tempura, roll combo and spicy chirashi bowl!
author: Dave C.

description:
We had lunch here, opting for the lunch boxes. Got a selection of items. The Chicken Katsu, Tonkatsu and Alaska Roll were particularly good.

Friendly service, regularly making contact but being not intrusive. Will likely return.
author: Graham T.

description: I really liked this place. The savor is really good and I found it cheap!
author: Mónica D.

description: Great little sushi place. Enjoyed the dark ambience and the unfiltered nigiri. The dumplings and the fried chicken bite app were both great.
author: Aman S.

description:
*Terrible Customer Service * So I walked in tonight, no one to greet us so we sat down at a booth close to the bar hoping to eat soon. Everyone was in the back for at least a few minutes before she came out. There were not that many people there at all.

The waitress said "oh I'm busy, did you need something?, let me seat you somewhere else where there is 2 person seating, this is for 4". This is at 9:30pm,  I said "why cant we sit here? There are so many seats" - seriously like 10 tables open. She went to "talk to her manager", which I saw her walk a few steps and turn back - and told us to move. 

My friend looked at me and said "Do you want to leave?" and I said yes. I told the waitress we were leaving - which she said okay. No trying to reclaim our business, I was pissed.

I'm glad I left - because I went to Barracuda down the street and the sushi there was awesome. Osaka you suck, all you have is location.
author: Rebekah T.

description: I haven't been here in years and I'm sad the quality of the food is not good anymore. My friends and I tried several dishes and not one was good. The miso soup was fishy and my tempura was cold. Won't be back
author: illy m.

description:
For a neighborhood sushi bar, this place offers solid meal without hurting my wallet. I had ordered assorted tempura and chirashi for dinner, rather than a dinner box set. It cost $40 after a large hot sake and tips.

The chirashi ($18.95) was paved with bricks of thickly cut fresh sashimi and Japanese pickled vegetables. When I asked for extra shiso leaves as condiment, the Chef probably gave me a dozen pieces without charging me. And their miso soup had used a more flavorful fish broth instead of just dashi. All the details showed a very generous attitude of this place.
author: Ming C.

description: Decent sushi. I ordered in from here so take my review with a grain of salt, but it wasn't anything over the top. The Seaweed Salad was good but isn't very difficult to do well, and the rolls tasted maybe a bit above average but I've had much better sushi at comparable prices (or cheaper) at other places in the city. Good if you're just looking for a bite, not necessarily if you're looking for a place to really get excited about.
author: Alex C.

description: Waited over 30 minutes for our food before we walk out. All we ordered was two California rolls and a spicy crunch roll. They really need to stop being cheap and hire more staff.
author: Edgar G.

description:
