description: The uni is pretty good, service is mediocre.  I guess you should just be glad there is sushi this good in the Castro.
author: gary p.

description: Went there last week.  I think I was spoiled by Tsunami Sushi where I had been to a month before because I was unimpressed.  The sushi was okay, but nothing to rave about. I wouldn't spend the money there again.
author: Anthony C.

description: Good sushi and service.  Many good choices, most of them are a little pricey, their rock-n-rolls are a great deal.
author: Sam B.

description: I eat here with friends because they have a good mix of vegan/vege options and the service is so bad we'll have plenty of time to chat. If you're overly polite or shy you'll hate this place because you have to be assertive, especially if you want anything from the wait staff - they're not proactive at all...
author: Quartknee K.

description: I fall in love with sushi through Osaka. In my country sushi is not so common as here. Its not only delicious but also very affordable. I love their lunch boxes.
author: Susan P.

description: I can say I like this little place its a great value and the fish is fresh. It's nothing to go crazy for but I still think its a good place. I've had several roles and their nigiri and I liked all of them. It's pretty dang cheap I think is the theme.
author: Jared B.

description: Im not sure why I never tried this sushi place before now, ive walked past it so many times. I went with my friend on a Tuesday evening around 7ish and we were seated right away. There's not much leg room...the tables are very close together and I'm tiny. So watch out for that. There were a bunch of interesting looking sushis on the menu, all with tons of ingredients... I was having a hard time focusing and deciding what to get! J got 3 rolls and I forget their names. I had 2 rolls. One was really good with mango and the eel one had a funny aftertaste. Each roll is about $10-12ish, which isnt cheap, but not really totally expensive either. The tea was yummy. I would come back here again because from what I tasted of my good roll and j's rolls I tried, and even the one I didn't totally like but ate anyways, this is a pretty yummy sushi place.  I liked that it was quiet enough to hear ourselves talk, unlike the place down the street. Oh and they have happy hr and lunch specials too, although we missed those time frames.
author: Merredith L.

description: Great service and best sushi in this part of the city.  Always friendly staff and something new and interesting on the menu board.
author: Vernon H.

description:
i judge a sushi restaurant by their chirashi. 

we came here on a saturday night, 30 minutes before closing.
the waiter seated us without rolling his eyes (something that usually happens when people enter your restaurant thisclose to closing)

had their chirashi, my partner had a philly roll. 

their chirashi was spectacular!

the quality of the fish was smooth, fresh, moist, and tender.
the quantity of the cuts was really generous, each thick piece cut the same size. 

3 cuts each of: tai (red snapper), maguro (tuna), hamachi (yellow tail), sake (salmon)
and 2 pieces each of: tako (octupus), tamago (egg), and amaebi (sweet shrimp)

i was amazed at how great their chirashi was! 
i'd been here 3 times previously, but for their sake, ramen, or rolls. 
this place is definitely a place i would go to again.
author: Maihien N.

description: they actually do have really good sushi, i just wish i wasn't so drunk every time i stumble in there to eat. maybe i would remember what rolls i tried the last time!
author: David F.

description: omg i got so sick after i ate here the fish was so old and disgusting .....service was very rude ..never going back
author: nami k.

description: I couldn't have been more disappointed with a restaurant. After ordering our entrees, we waited over 50 minutes to receive our simple bento boxes. I find that to be completely rediculous. There were only two cooks to feed over 30 people! It is disappointing to find one of the only japanese restaurants in the castro to be such a let down.
author: Jason S.

description: It's a tourist trap. Very simply: food is average; prices are a tad high; sushi chefs are not friendly and do not talk to their customers, even when it is not busy at all. The service is, well, bad and inconsistent. An example: my partner ordered Iced Tea and we got them and drank them down before we got our meals, but they were never refilled and we had no liquids to drink throughout the meal. When I got the check and started to fill out the tip, the waitress interjected, "do you want a refill?"; I said no. It was too late for that. Another example, it took 15 minutes, after we got our menus, for our orders to be taken. Busy? No...there were only 2 other customers in the entire restaurant at the time. There is no excuse for bad service and unfriendly chefs. When you are in the neighborhood and have a craving for sushi, I recommend that you go the extra few blocks to another sushi restaurant.
author: Aleks K.

description: If you're a big fan of creative rolls and prefer more cooked options for sushi, this is your place.  They have a wide variety of unique rolls, all the standard rolls and decent sashimi.   Sometimes the pieces are small and the fish is a bit tough, but worth a visit.  Service is fine- haven't had a any of the issues other readers report.
author: Jane M.

description: I have been going to Osaka Sushi for about 4 years now. I use to have a special waitress that I would go see all the time. She always knew what I wanted to have and would also bring out little treats to sample. Great service and clean environment. Sometimes really busy though so be careful when you decide to go. Also a great place to Sake bomb with wonderful food and great friends. Make sure you check out this place!
author: BOB M.

description: This place has really fresh, interesting and tasty rolls (read: not cheap). The Tri-Color roll is the best....I go there just for it!
author: M B.

description: we used to be regulars here and have officially banned this place a few months ago . we figured that since we were regulars, we would be treated with the basics of what one expects as far as customer service when going out to eat . it's sad because we really liked the sushi and sashimi salad but we will never be going back there ever again .. we got the very rude treatment from at least two of their workers .. both even gave attitude .. word of advice .. when going here, don't even think about requesting a specific table or asking for a menu when you have been seated and waited a very long time for menu .. otherwise you get the biggest attitude back from the workers .. we walked out for the last time after going there up to three or four times a month .. we do not consider us being difficult customers at all .. for the amount of $$ u pay at this place, you would think you would get more than a McDonald's level of customer service ..
author: Michael P.

description: Inconsistent.  First time went there the sushi was good and fresh.  Went there again last week and sushi not so fresh and service was only fair.
author: reza f.

description: After my third visit here, the civic urge to give this place the review it deserves won over general laziness. The fish is very fresh, and there you have it, all it takes for good sushi. Stuffed eggplant and goma-ae are other good dishes. The atmosphere can quite get a bit boisterous at times, especially on days when the California supreme court lifts the constitutional ban on same sex marriages, but thats a tradeoff we can all definitely live with :) Besides, having delightful company helps!
author: Shwin S.

description: I have always enjoyed dining at Osaka.  The neighborly atmosphere, friendly staffs and fresh seafood speak for itself.  I am especially thrilled by the Grilled Hamachi Kama, which I never failed to order whenever  I dined there.  Its always prepared to perfection, slightly charred on the outside, while still soft in the inside.  And being the best value in town for this dish ($7), helps.
author: Ron L.

description:
I love this place.  Maybe it's because I always come from Yoga Flow and I am sweaty and tired and in my yoga zone.  Or maybe it's because I fell in love with my fiance over a number of these post-yoga glow meals, but the food is incredible too.  Michael always orders us the shirashi bowls.  I have never seen it on the menu, but it consists of a bowl of rice topped with a ton of sashimi.  They also have incredibly good and inventive rolls, as well as good hot sake.  The shirashi bowls always change too, sometimes they have large, luscious fish eggs, another time there was some of that slightly sweet baked egg.  
The service is also great.  Michael is allergic to shell fish and they are always very conscientious of keeping his bowl clean.  The waiters and friendly and funny and willing to take any of our questions, concerns, etc with humor and grace (it's almost always just drink refills).  Hard to park in that neighborhood, but well worth the effort.
author: Evan A.

description: My friends and I love this place. Whenever we stop by the Castro, we'll always come in to have lunch. We always get the bento box specials, which is superb, lots of options. Their portions are so big, we never finish. I've had their sukiyaki, california rolls, tempura. They're friendly, but they come to check on you once or twice only (which is fantastic as I like to talk to the waiters but I enjoy talking to my friends more).
author: Lily L.

description: Its in my neighborhood so i tend to go to Osaka for sushi quite often. The sushi is always consistent in quality and very fresh.  I would really recommend the special rolls.The only downfall is that the service can be very spotty. It seems like they always have new servers.
author: eric b.

description: I love this place. We went in again the other night and even though the place was packed our waiter Dean made us feel like we were the only people in the place. It hasn't changed mover the years, just good reliable food.
author: Frank M.

description: terrible service. food is somewhat ok though, depending on the night you go.  i saw what looked like the manager or owner pick up sushi that he dropped and then plop it back onto the plate. yuck. unacceptable.
author: Sophia M.
